definition: reign name (196-219) at the end of the Han dynasty
to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname An

sentences.english: The paper decides the effective range, proposes to support efficient energy products makers development for cost cutdown.
sentences.chinese: 建築節能導致建安成本增加，確定其影響的幅度。

sentences.english: The first part gives a simple summary to the sad wind image in Jianan poetry.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分對建安詩歌中悲風意象進行簡單的概括。

sentences.english: Jian'an era, all kinds of literary forms took on a new look with their new development.
sentences.chinese: 建安時代，各體文學都有新的發展，呈現出新面貌。

sentences.english: In Jian an period of Han Dynasty, conscript soldiers replaced gradually compulsory soldiers and became the main body of the army.
sentences.chinese: 建安年間，募兵逐漸取代義務兵成爲軍隊的主要成分。

sentences.english: The writers' writing on same topic effect literature in many aspects in Jianan period.
sentences.chinese: 建安文人同題共作的意義與作用是多元的。

definition: Wancheng district of Nanyang city 南陽|南阳[Nan2 yang2], Henan
Eastern Wu (222-280)/the southern state of Wu during the Three Kingdoms period, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权
Cao Wei, the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms, established as a dynasty in 220 by Cao Pi 曹丕, son of Cao Cao, replaced by Jin dynasty in 265
Sun Ce (175-200), general and major warlord of the Later Han Dynasty
Yuan Shao (153-202), general during late Han, subsequently warlord
Sunwu county in Heihe 黑河[Hei1 he2], Heilongjiang
battle of Guandu of 199 that established Cao Cao's 曹操 domination over north China, at Guandu (near modern 許昌|许昌[Xu3 chang1] in north Henan)
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
Liu Biao (142-208), warlord
Jingzhou prefecture-level city on Changjiang in Hubei

Cao Cao (155-220), famous statesman and general at the end of Han, noted poet and calligrapher, later warlord, founder and first king of Cao Wei 曹魏, father of Emperor Cao Pi 曹丕/the main villain of novel the Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义
Cao Pi (187-226), second son of Cao Cao 曹操, king then emperor of Cao Wei 曹魏 from 220, ruled as Emperor Wen 魏文帝, also a noted calligrapher
Lü Meng (178-219), general of the southern state of Wu
Liu Bei (161-223), warlord at the end of the Han dynasty and founder of the Han kingdom of Shu 蜀漢|蜀汉 (c. 200-263), later the Shu Han dynasty
name of old state in modern Sichuan
Xinye county in Nanyang 南陽|南阳[Nan2 yang2], Henan
